gw.api.database.upgrade.after

Class IAfterUpgradeTable<T extends Bean>

  • gw.api.database.upgrade.after.IAfterUpgradeTable<T>

  • public class IAfterUpgradeTable<T extends Bean>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String Name
      full name of the table

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IDeleteBuilder delete()
      IAfterUpgradeTable<Bean> drop()
      Includes dropping the foreign keys from this to others and from others to this
      IAfterUpgradeTable<Bean> dropColumns(IAfterUpgradeColumn[] columns)
      More efficient operation that allows dropping multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
      boolean exists()
      Check whether the table exists in the database
      IAfterUpgradeColumn getColumn(IEntityPropertyInfo column)
      IAfterUpgradeColumn getColumn(String columnName)
      Use to get at a column that is not backed by a property, i.e. one that has been deleted
      IInsertBuilder insert()
      Note that if you are not in a transaction, you can also use a Bundle to perform the insert.
      IInsertSelectBuilder insertSelect(IAfterUpgradeTable<T> sourceTable)
      Query<Bean> query()
      IUpdateBuilder update()

      • dropColumns

        IAfterUpgradeTable<Bean> dropColumns(IAfterUpgradeColumn[] columns)
        More efficient operation that allows dropping multiple columns in one operation. Some databases don't support this, so multiple operations will be performed.
        Parameters:
        columns -
        Returns:
        this

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Check whether the table exists in the database
        Returns:
        true if table exists in the database; false otherwise

        Parameters:
        column - property
        Returns:
        The object representing the column for the given property

      • getColumn

        IAfterUpgradeColumn getColumn(String columnName)
        Use to get at a column that is not backed by a property, i.e. one that has been deleted
        Parameters:
        columnName - name of column
        Returns:
        The object representing the column with the given name

      • insert

        IInsertBuilder insert()
        Note that if you are not in a transaction, you can also use a Bundle to perform the insert.
        Returns:
        an Insert builder for this table

      • insertSelect

        IInsertSelectBuilder insertSelect(IAfterUpgradeTable<T> sourceTable)
        Parameters:
        sourceTable - table to use as source of the insert-select
        Returns:
        an InsertSelect query builder with this table as the target and the given table as the source

      • query

        Query<Bean> query()
        Returns:
        a Query builder (SELECT statement) for this table

        Returns:
        an Update builder for this table
